snippet: Twenty-one officers assigned to the United States Embassy were suspended pending an investigation into whether they skimmed part of $12.5 million seized in a drug cartel raid.
abstract: Twenty-one police officers assigned to United States Embassy in Honduras are suspended on suspicion they took $1.3 million from $12.5 million seized in October 2014 raid of Valle Valle drug cartel; money was recovered during capture of leader MIguel Valle Valle; Honduras has world’s highest murder rate and police have been accused of corruption and extrajudicial killings.
lead_paragraph: Twenty-one officers assigned to the United States Embassy were suspended pending an investigation into whether they skimmed part of $12.5 million seized in a drug cartel raid.

headline.main: Honduras: Police at U.S. Embassy Are Suspended Over Missing Money
headline.print_headline: Honduras: Police at U.S. Embassy Are Suspended Over Missing Money
